com.camerontec.util.system

Class InstanceDetectionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.system.InstanceDetectionManager

  • public final class InstanceDetectionManager
extends Object
    Detects duplicate instances of an application by binding to a unique socket on the loopback adapter.

    The socket port can be chosen explicitly, or chosen deterministically from the specified range based on the application's unique identifier.

    In the latter case, two instances configured with the same identifier will cause a DuplicateInstanceException to be thrown when the second instance starts. Depending on the size of the range, it's possible that different identifiers may map to the same port. If such a collision occurs, an explicit port must be configured.

    • Constructor Detail

      • InstanceDetectionManager

        public InstanceDetectionManager(int port)
        Create an instance using a specific socket port.
        Parameters:
        port - the socket port to bind to
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the port is not between 1024 and 65535 inclusive

      • InstanceDetectionManager

        public InstanceDetectionManager(String identifier,
                                int portRangeLow,
                                int portRangeHigh)
        Create an instance that chooses a socket port from the specified range based on the identifier.
        Parameters:
        identifier - a unique application identifier
        portRangeLow - minimum inclusive port
        portRangeHigh - maximum inclusive port
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the identifier is null or if the port range is not between 1024 and 65535 inclusive

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
           throws IOException
        Start and bind to the socket.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs while creating the socket (except if the port is in use)
        DuplicateInstanceException - if the configured port is already bound
        IllegalStateException - if already started
